intro: Cyphostemma burgeri, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in shrublands and woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
